Uses of Class
asciipanel.AsciiRaster

Packages that use AsciiRaster
Package Description
asciipanel  
imageeditor  

  • Uses of AsciiRaster in asciipanel

    Methods in asciipanel that return AsciiRaster
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    AsciiRaster AsciiRaster.clone()
    Creates a deep copy of the raster, whose character and color arrays are independent from the original ones.
    AsciiRaster AsciiPanelModel.getRaster()
    Gets the raster that is currently displayed
    AsciiRaster AsciiPainter.getSurface()
    Gets the instance of AsciiRaster where the painter draws.
    AsciiRaster AsciiRasterReader.read()
    Create an instance of AsciiRaster by loading data from a file.
    Methods in asciipanel with parameters of type AsciiRaster
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    AsciiPainter AsciiPainter.drawRaster​(AsciiRaster raster, boolean transparent, boolean center)
    Draws a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency.
    AsciiPainter AsciiPainter.drawRasterChars​(AsciiRaster raster, boolean transparent, boolean center)
    Draws characters from a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency.
    void AsciiPanelModel.setRaster​(AsciiRaster raster)
    Sets the raster to display
    void AsciiRasterWriter.write​(AsciiRaster rast)
    Write data from an instance of AsciiRaster into a file.
    Constructors in asciipanel with parameters of type AsciiRaster
    Constructor Description
    AsciiPainter​(AsciiRaster surface)
    Create a new painter instance with the specified surface.
    AsciiPanelModel​(AsciiRaster raster)
    Constructs an AsciiPanelModel with specified raster and default font (CP437_9x16)
    AsciiPanelModel​(AsciiRaster raster, AsciiFont font)
    Constructs an AsciiPanelModel with specified raster and font

  • Uses of AsciiRaster in imageeditor

    Methods in imageeditor with parameters of type AsciiRaster
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void ImageConverter.convertTo​(AsciiRaster raster, java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
    Converts the given image to ASCII art and writes the result to the given raster.
